name: HEKAPUR Hartschaum H Komponente A (Materialnr. 000010)
hazard_category: Polyol component for polyurethane foam; causes serious eye irritation, suspected of damaging fertility and the unborn child
hazards_description: Classified as causing serious eye irritation (Eye Irrit. 2, H319) and as a suspected reproductive toxicant (Repr. 2, H361fd: suspected of damaging fertility and the unborn child). [attached_file:file:9] Contains alkylaminopolyoxyalkylenol (approx. 20–25%) and trimethylolpropane (approx. 1–5%), which contribute to eye irritation and reproductive toxicity classification. [attached_file:file:9]
protective_measures: Avoid any contact with eyes and skin and avoid inhalation of vapours or aerosols; ensure adequate general ventilation and, where possible, local exhaust at processing machines. [attached_file:file:9] Keep containers tightly closed, store in a cool, well-ventilated place protected from direct sunlight and away from food, drink and animal feed; do not expose to temperatures above 50 °C. [attached_file:file:9] Wear chemical-resistant protective gloves (e.g. butyl rubber approx. 0.7 mm or nitrile rubber approx. 0.4 mm with sufficient breakthrough time), safety goggles/face shield and suitable protective clothing; remove contaminated clothing immediately and wash hands thoroughly after work. [attached_file:file:9]
emergency_procedures: In case of accidental release, ensure good ventilation, keep away from ignition sources and use suitable personal protective equipment; avoid contact with skin, eyes and clothing. [attached_file:file:9] Prevent the product from entering drains, surface water or groundwater; absorb spilled material with suitable binders such as sand, diatomaceous earth, acid binder or universal binder and collect mechanically into appropriate containers for disposal. [attached_file:file:9] Contaminated surfaces must be thoroughly cleaned; disposal of collected material must follow local regulations. [attached_file:file:9]

first_aid.hautkontakt: Beschmutzte, getränkte Kleidung sofort ausziehen; betroffene Hautpartien mit viel Wasser und Seife gründlich waschen; bei Hautreizung oder -ausschlag ärztlichen Rat einholen oder ärztliche Hilfe hinzuziehen. [attached_file:file:9]
first_aid.augenkontakt: Bei Kontakt mit den Augen sofort bei geöffnetem Lidspalt 10–15 Minuten mit fließendem Wasser spülen; vorhandene Kontaktlinsen nach Möglichkeit entfernen und weiter spülen; anschließend umgehend Augenarzt aufsuchen. [attached_file:file:9]
first_aid.verschlucken: Mund sofort mit Wasser ausspülen und reichlich Wasser nachtrinken; einer bewusstlosen Person oder bei Krämpfen nichts über den Mund geben; kein Erbrechen herbeiführen; sofort Arzt hinzuziehen. [attached_file:file:9]
first_aid.einatmen: Betroffene Person aus dem Gefahrenbereich an die frische Luft bringen und ruhig lagern; bei anhaltenden Beschwerden oder Unwohlsein ärztlichen Rat einholen. [attached_file:file:9]

first_aider_reference: Ersthelfer sollen geeignete persönliche Schutzausrüstung tragen und kontaminierte Kleidung sofort entfernen; bei anhaltenden Beschwerden oder bei Augenbeteiligung immer ärztliche Hilfe hinzuziehen. [attached_file:file:9]
disposal: Prefer recycling or recovery where possible; otherwise dispose of product according to local official regulations, e.g. by controlled incineration; exact waste code must be agreed with the waste disposer or authority, as it depends on the actual use. [attached_file:file:9] Contaminated packaging must be handled like the substance; non-contaminated, completely emptied packaging can be sent for recycling after appropriate cleaning. [attached_file:file:9]
